title: Pure white background enforcement across all site sections

requirements.summary: Remove non-white section backgrounds, gradients, and full-bleed hero imagery so all pages/sections render on a pure white background (including header/footer and hero).
acceptanceCriteria: When scrolling through the entire site, no section uses tinted backgrounds (e.g., bg-muted/*) or gradient backgrounds that visually change the page background away from white.
The hero section does not use a full-bleed background image or overlay that makes the page background appear non-white; the hero background appears white like the rest of the page.
Header and footer backgrounds appear white (no muted/tinted backgrounds) while maintaining readable text contrast.
Global base backgrounds remain white for html/body/#root in light mode.

file_operations.description: Remove the full-bleed background image and gradient overlay layer so the hero renders on a white background consistent with the rest of the page; keep content layout/spacing and ensure text remains readable against white.
Replace the section-level tinted background (bg-muted/40) with a pure white background (e.g., bg-background/bg-white) so the section does not visually tint the page.

Replace the section-level tinted background (bg-muted/40) with a pure white background (e.g., bg-background/bg-white) to keep the page background uniformly white while preserving internal card styling.

Replace the call-to-action panel gradient background (bg-gradient-to-*) with a white background treatment (e.g., bg-card/bg-background with border/shadow) so no gradients alter the perceived page background.
Replace the footer tinted background (bg-muted/50) with a pure white background (bg-background/bg-white) while keeping borders/typography for readable contrast.
Ensure the header background is explicitly white in both scrolled and unscrolled states (avoid any muted/tinted background tokens); keep blur/shadow behavior without introducing non-white tints.
Ensure the top-level app wrapper/main content area does not introduce any non-white background class and remains consistent with a pure white page background throughout.
Confirm and, if needed, tighten global light-mode base styles so html/body/#root render as pure white and no global gradients/background images are applied.

Confirm and, if needed, tighten global light-mode base styles so html/body/#root render as pure white and no global gradients/background images are applied (keep consistent with the active stylesheet configuration).
